items.description: The tidal River Yare from Thorpe St Andrew to Breydon Water
items.message: Levels are now below the flood risk thresholds.  The forecast is for no current flood risk from high tides.  There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away.  Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.  We will continue to monitor levels closely.

items.description: Humber estuary from Spurn Point to Winestead Outfall
items.message: This flood alert has been removed as this evenings high tide has now passed (Wednesday 19th January) and levels are back below levels of concern

items.description: North Sea coast from Staithes to Whitby including tidal River Esk
items.message: This flood alert has been removed as coastal conditions are improving and have fallen below levels of concern. Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

We will continue to monitor levels closely.

items.message: Levels are now well below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast is for no current flood risk from high tides. There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

floodArea.county: County Durham, Hartlepool, North Tyneside, South Tyneside, Sunderland

items.message:
This Flood Alert remains in force because some minor flooding to coastal roads and footpaths is likely this afternoon on Thursday 20/01/2022 between 15:00PM and 20:00PM. Large offshore waves are being created by strong north westerly winds. Areas most at risk include beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads at Seaburn lower promenade and Seaham harbour and docks.
No property flooding is expected.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 21/01/2022, or as the situation changes.
